title: "Umlauf Sculpture Gardens" font ID help?
content:
Hey guys,

here is the link to the image...

[http://image.volunteersolutions.org/images/cache/000/000/023/950/2395075...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154320/http:/image.volunteersolutions.org/images/cache/000/000/023/950/23950755.jpg "http://image.volunteersolutions.org/images/cache/000/000/023/950/23950755.jpg")

It seems like some type of Bauhaus, but i can’t find exactly what it is. I appreciate the help.

-Josh

 [‹ Nova festival, russian characters](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154320/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33145 "Go to previous forum topic") [city of LA - serif ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154320/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33126 "Go to next forum topic")
author: wolfattack

comments.content: Reminds me of Kleptocracy from Typodermic, though that’s not it.

Looks like Qhytsackx as well, but then the A, L & F would have been customized.

[http://www.dafont.com/search.php?q=qhy&nb\_ppp\_old=10&page=1&text=UMLAUF&...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154320/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?q=qhy&nb_ppp_old=10&page=1&text=UMLAUF&nb_ppp=10&psize=m&classt=alpha "http://www.dafont.com/search.php?q=qhy&nb\_ppp\_old=10&page=1&text=UMLAUF&nb\_ppp=10&psize=m&classt=alpha")
is the “sculpture gardens & museum” line the same facee? doesn’t seem as tall, any ideas?
The sub-text is something ordinary like Century Gothic (Bold).

any other ideas for the subtext what it might be. I was thinking Century Gothic bold as well, but it seems like the letters are taller than Century Gothic.

hmmm.

It looks like it’s just [squooshed](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154320/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/squooshed) Century Gothic.

- Lex
